intro: Spilotantha, commonly known as the "blue flax" or "spilotantha," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to blue. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spilotantha species are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
